overview: From 2026-01-08 to 2026-01-09, elizaos/eliza had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 5 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topIssues.title: New copy for agent builder
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Old copy: New copy: Hi, I'm Eliza. I can help build your agent in two different ways: 1. You can describe what you're imagining - personality, purpose, whatever - and I'll create the agent conversationally as we go. 2. You can also build the agent manually on the right. So, what are we making?

topIssues.title: New copy for agent edit
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Old copy: New copy: You can update your agent conversationally in this space, or edit them directly on the right. What needs tweaking?

topIssues.title: On mobile, in agent builder, can we set name of agent to start with capital letter by default
topIssues.author: borisudovicic

topIssues.title: Can we make these boxes the same size?
topIssues.author: borisudovicic

topPRs.title: feat(plugin-sql): add Neon serverless support & improve RLS security
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR introduces several improvements to the plugin-sql package focused on security, clarity, and Neon serverless database support.

### Key Changes

1. **Neon Serverless Support** - Added dedicated adapter and connection manager for Neon databases using `@neondatabase/serverless`, providing WebSocket-based connections optimized for serverless environments.

2. **Unified RLS Context Method** - Renamed `withEntityContext` to `withIsolationContext` to better reflect that it handles both Server RLS (`app.server_id`) and Entity RLS (`app.entity_id`) context in a single transaction.

3. **SQL Injection Protection** - Migrated from `sql.raw()` string interpolation to `set_config()` with parameterized queries for setting RLS context variables. This provides defense-in-depth against SQL injection.

## Technical Details

### RLS Context Setting - Before vs After

**Before (vulnerable to SQL injection):**
```typescript
await tx.execute(sql.raw(`SET LOCAL app.entity_id = '${entityId}'`));
```

**After (parameterized and secure):**
```typescript
await tx.execute(sql`SELECT set_config('app.entity_id', ${entityId}, true)`);
```

Both approaches are functionally identical:
- `set_config('app.entity_id', $1, true)` with params `[entityId]`
- The third parameter `true` means transaction-local (same as `SET LOCAL`)

The key difference is that `set_config()` supports parameterized queries while `SET LOCAL` does not, providing proper SQL injection protection.

### Neon Serverless Architecture

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    NeonDatabaseAdapter                   │
│  - Extends BaseDrizzleAdapter                           │
│  - Auto-detects Neon URLs (*.neon.tech)                 │
│  - WebSocket-based connections for edge/serverless      │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                            │
                            ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                  NeonConnectionManager                   │
│  - Uses @neondatabase/serverless Pool                   │
│  - Connection pooling handled by Neon's proxy           │
│  - withIsolationContext() for RLS                       │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Files Changed

| File | Change |
|------|--------|
| `src/neon/adapter.ts` | New Neon database adapter |
| `src/neon/manager.ts` | New Neon connection manager with `withIsolationContext` |
| `src/pg/manager.ts` | Updated to use `set_config()` with parameterization |
| `src/base.ts` | Renamed method to `withIsolationContext` |
| `src/rls.ts` | Updated `current_server_id()` to read from `app.server_id` |
| `src/index.node.ts` | Added Neon URL detection and adapter selection |
| `src/pglite/adapter.ts` | Added `withIsolationContext` (no-op for PGLite) |
| `src/__tests__/integration/postgres/rls-*.test.ts` | Updated to use `SET app.server_id` |
| `src/__tests__/unit/pg/manager.test.ts` | Updated to verify `set_config()` usage |

## Test Plan

- [x] Unit tests pass (160 tests)
- [x] Server unit tests pass (431 tests)
- [x] PostgreSQL integration tests pass (41 tests)
- [x] RLS integration tests pass (28 tests)
  - [x] rls-entity.test.ts (8 tests)
  - [x] rls-server.test.ts (5 tests)
  - [x] rls-logs.test.ts (8 tests)
  - [x] rls-message-server-agents.test.ts (7 tests)
- [x] Server integration tests pass (10 tests)

## Breaking Changes

- `withEntityContext` renamed to `withIsolationContext` - update any direct calls to this method

## Security Considerations

This PR addresses a potential SQL injection vector identified in PR review:

| Aspect | Before | After |
|--------|--------|-------|
| Query Type | String interpolation | Parameterized query |
| SQL Injection | Possible (if UUID validation bypassed) | Not possible |
| Behavior | Transaction-local | Transaction-local |
| Performance | Same | Same |

While UUID validation already provides protection, using parameterized queries adds defense-in-depth following security best practices.

## References

- [PostgreSQL set_config documentation](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/config-setting.html)
- [Crunchy Data - Row Level Security for Tenants](https://www.crunchydata.com/blog/row-level-security-for-tenants-in-postgres)
- [Permit.io - Postgres RLS Implementation Guide](https://www.permit.io/blog/postgres-rls-implementation-guide)
